title: Caroline Flack goes topless again in Ibiza as she accidentally lets her towel slip
text:

Caroline Flack has been showing off her wild streak on holiday in Ibiza, going topless once more .

Ahead of winter Love Island the presenter has been having a whale of a time soaking up the sun and shedding her bikini tops.

After enjoying a seafood lunch Cazza shared a selfie on her Instagram Stories with the intention of covering up her modesty with a towel.

With her beachy blonde waves cascading over her shoulders and a wearing no make-up Caroline grasped her sunnies as she peered into the camera.

But the 39-year-old accidentally revealed a little more than she perhaps was expecting, exposing her chest to her followers with just a small location tag attempting to cover up her nipple.

(Image: Instagram)

Caroline paid no mind to the nipslip and shows she's fully embracing her new attitude.

Earlier in the week she posted a snap of herself sunbathing without a bikini top writing alongside the black and white image 'nudist'.

The leggy beauty appeared happy and relaxed as she concealed her ample assets as she laid on her front and tied her hair up in order to let the sun kiss her back and peachy bottom.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

It seems Caroline put the frustration of yesterday behind her as she basked in the sunshine while holidaying on the Spanish isle.

She was spotted with her boyfriend Lewis Burton onboard a yacht looking close to tears as they appeared to argue.

During their heated discussion, the TV host looked fuming as she crossed her arms while Lewis leaned in towards his lover when they sat together.

The presenter got emotional and turned her head away from her handsome man as he appeared to try and console her.

Although the pair were alone on the yacht at the time they have been holidaying with a group of friends.

Time off from her busy schedule means Caroline has been able to focus on her love life before she gets back to work on the new winter series of Love Island which is launching in January.

This will see another bunch of hopefuls heading to Cape Town in South Africa, with the view of starting 2020 by finding the perfect partner under the winter sun.
